titleInfo.title: In Re Settoon Towing, LLC
titleInfo.subTitle: St. Paul's Motion for Summary Judgment regarding pollution coverage is GRANTED, and Settoon's claims against St. Paul are DISMISSED WITH PREJUDICE. FURTHERED ORDERED that 489 SNIC's Motion for Partial Summary Judgment regarding polluORDERED that 402 Settoon's Motions to Strike are DENIED as to: Paragraph 2(c) on Page 10 of the Complaint for Declaratory Judgment as it Relates to NYMAGIC and Federal; NYMAGIC's Supplemental and Amending Answer to Interrogatory No. 2; Federal's Supplemental and Amending Answer to Interrogatory No. 2. FURTHER ORDERED that 411 Settoon's Cross Motion for Partial Summary Judgment against NYMAGIC and Federal regarding pollution coverage is DENIED. FURTHER ORDERED that 486 tion coverage is GRANTED AS UNOPPOSED as to the marine general liability policy and the hull and machinery/protection and indemnity policy; and DENIED as to the first layer bumbershoot policy. FURTHER ORDERED that 495 Settoon's Cross Motion for Partial Summary Judgment against SNIC regarding pollution coverage is GRANTED. FURTHER ORDER that 392 NYMAGIC's and Federal's Motion for Summary Judgment regarding pollution coverage is GRANTED, and Settoon's claims against NYMAGIC and Federal are DISMISSED WITH PREJUDICE. FURTHER ORDERED that 496 Settoon's Cross Motion for Partial Summary Judgment against St. Paul regarding pollution coverage is DENIED. Signed by Judge Mary Ann Vial Lemmon on 9/23/2011. (Reference: All Cases)(clm, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:07-cv-01263; In Re Settoon Towing, LLC;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of Louisiana
extension.docketText: St. Paul's Motion for Summary Judgment regarding pollution coverage is GRANTED, and Settoon's claims against St. Paul are DISMISSED WITH PREJUDICE. FURTHERED ORDERED that 489 SNIC's Motion for Partial Summary Judgment regarding polluORDERED that 402 Settoon's Motions to Strike are DENIED as to: Paragraph 2(c) on Page 10 of the Complaint for Declaratory Judgment as it Relates to NYMAGIC and Federal; NYMAGIC's Supplemental and Amending Answer to Interrogatory No. 2; Federal's Supplemental and Amending Answer to Interrogatory No. 2. FURTHER ORDERED that 411 Settoon's Cross Motion for Partial Summary Judgment against NYMAGIC and Federal regarding pollution coverage is DENIED. FURTHER ORDERED that 486 tion coverage is GRANTED AS UNOPPOSED as to the marine general liability policy and the hull and machinery/protection and indemnity policy; and DENIED as to the first layer bumbershoot policy. FURTHER ORDERED that 495 Settoon's Cross Motion for Partial Summary Judgment against SNIC regarding pollution coverage is GRANTED. FURTHER ORDER that 392 NYMAGIC's and Federal's Motion for Summary Judgment regarding pollution coverage is GRANTED, and Settoon's claims against NYMAGIC and Federal are DISMISSED WITH PREJUDICE. FURTHER ORDERED that 496 Settoon's Cross Motion for Partial Summary Judgment against St. Paul regarding pollution coverage is DENIED. Signed by Judge Mary Ann Vial Lemmon on 9/23/2011. (Reference: All Cases)(clm, )

titleInfo.title: In Re Settoon Towing, LLC
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT under Rule 54(b) in favor of defendant and plaintiff-in-counterclaim, Settoon Towing, LLC, and against plaintiff and defendant-in-counterclaim, State National Insurance Company. Further Ordered that judgment is in favor of plaintiffs and defendants-in-counterclaim, New York Marine and General Insurance Company and Federal Insurance Company, and third-party defendant, St. Paul Fire and Marine Insurance Company, and against defendant, plaintiff-in-counterclaim, and third-party plaintiff, Settoon Towing, LLC. Signed by Judge Mary Ann Vial Lemmon.(Reference: Both Cases)(ecm, )

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 2:07-cv-01263; In Re Settoon Towing, LLC;
extension.courtName: United States District Court Eastern District of Louisiana
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT under Rule 54(b) in favor of defendant and plaintiff-in-counterclaim, Settoon Towing, LLC, and against plaintiff and defendant-in-counterclaim, State National Insurance Company. Further Ordered that judgment is in favor of plaintiffs and defendants-in-counterclaim, New York Marine and General Insurance Company and Federal Insurance Company, and third-party defendant, St. Paul Fire and Marine Insurance Company, and against defendant, plaintiff-in-counterclaim, and third-party plaintiff, Settoon Towing, LLC. Signed by Judge Mary Ann Vial Lemmon.(Reference: Both Cases)(ecm, )
